race.name: Border Wars
race.tagline: Creek crossings and red-clay gravel along the Georgia-Alabama border.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through GA/AL countryside. Moderate elevation with countryside scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional Southeast event. Rolling terrain with moderate organization and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Border Wars is a regional event on the GA/AL border—rolling terrain with moderate elevation. The GA/AL countryside is nice, but the moderate organization and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3. GA/AL border provides good access.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional Southeast gravel race with rolling terrain. Worth it for GA/AL/Southeast cyclists. Not a destination race for national travelers.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in GA/AL/Southeast and want a local event—yes, it's solid. If you're from out of region—there are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For similar regional events: other Southeast gravel races. For more elevation: NC/TN gravel races.

logistics.airport: Atlanta (ATL) or Birmingham (BHM) depending on location
logistics.lodging_strategy: GA/AL border has moderate lodging options.
logistics.food: GA/AL has full dining options. Stock nutrition.
logistics.parking:
parking at Heard County High School (600+ parking spots, room for RVs)
- Some on-street parking downtown and small parking lot sout
logistics.camping:
camping and RV spaces (no electricity or water hook-ups)
- Limited hotels in Franklin

non_negotiables.why: GA/AL rolling countryside requires sustained effort.

logistics.explanation: Packet pickup at S&S Fire Pits the day before shows local business integration and prevents race morning chaos. Franklin, Georgia provides a small-town race hub without big-city complications, though specific parking and lodging details remain vague. The missing airport and accommodation strategy information keeps this from being higher.

length.explanation: The 62-mile main option delivers 5000 feet over varied terrain, with Jason Lopez completing it in 5:58 moving time at 245W normalized power. Bridge washouts forced last-minute course changes, shortening routes by "a few miles," but the staggered starts (8am/9:30am/11am) "significantly reduced the number of riders at the start of the race." Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: The mud logjam one mile in forced riders to "walk single file around the deepest section," while the course features "gravel with random chunks that could cause a pinch flat if hit wrong." Jason Lopez excelled on descents with "two top 10s" on Strava segments, noting the course had "quite a few fast technical descents" and sketchy bridge crossings. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: 5000 feet over 62 miles delivers consistent work without massive climbing blocks. The rolling profile with ridgeline connections means you're always going up or down, but nothing suggests monster climbs that separate the field. Alabama's steep, direct descents into creek crossings provide the most elevation drama. Less climbing than The Mid South. As Carolyn Misick puts it: "Their website and FAQ page was one of the most helpful ones I have seen for what to expect on the ride."

climate.explanation: The 2024 race started at 38°F and warmed to 60°F with "20-30 mph gusts with mostly headwind," making the Alabama section particularly challenging. Carolyn Misick appreciated the "sunny and temps in the 60s" forecast, though the temperature range "made it a bit tough to dress for." Late February timing avoids summer heat while staying generally rideable. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: GA/AL border region means you're barely above sea level throughout the course. Starting elevation and max elevation are unreported, but this isn't mountain territory—it's rolling piedmont that won't challenge anyone's oxygen intake. Altitude is completely irrelevant to this race experience. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Creek crossings provide the main adventure elements, with Carolyn Misick noting "sinking your shoe into deep muddy water" before a "stream crossing at the bottom" that served as a "shoe wash." The route crosses state lines mid-race, and Carolyn enjoyed seeing "my time greatly improve as we rode through Alabama which is on central standard time."

prestige.explanation: Three years old and still finding its identity—started as Border Wars, morphed into Homegrown Gravel Adventure, but everyone still calls it Border Wars. No pro field, no prize purse, no mention of notable winners in any coverage. It's a solid regional event that locals respect for the terrain punishment, but it's not moving any needles beyond the GA/AL border.

race_quality.explanation: The organizer claims it's 'quite possibly the best route I have ever created,' but the execution shows growing pains. Mud logjams forced walking sections in 2024, and riders report confusion about state crossings due to twists that obscure the border theme. Aid station details are vague, cutoff times unknown, and the course suffers from identity issues between being a border battle and scenic tour.

experience.explanation: The GA/AL gravel contrast delivers—Georgia's smooth ridgeline meandering versus Alabama's steep, direct punishment creates a split personality ride. Riders enjoy the remote scenic views and appreciate how the 30 miles of paved connectors blend the sectors intelligently. The mud chaos and terrain variety make for memorable war stories, even if the 'border war' theme gets lost in the twists.

community.explanation: Donates around $2000 to MTB Atlanta and Heard County Food Pantry, showing local investment. The home-grown vibe emphasizes stewardship—respect roads, locals, and land—which resonates with riders who want substance over flash. Early packet pickup at S&S Fire Pits creates a regional gathering feel, though the field size remains mysteriously unreported.

field_depth.explanation: With a field of 200-400 riders, no data on field size, no mention of competitive depth, and YouTube coverage shows riders walking through mud sections rather than racing through them. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100. As Jason Lopez puts it: "I am quite pleased with my race performance in the 2024 Border Wars Gravel, I finished 11th in my category, even with 7500 ft of climbing. My average speed was 16."

value.explanation: Registration cost $91.78 total ($85 plus BikeReg fees) with spots available until a week before the event. The route delivers 65% gravel across two states with three aid stations, including "Oreos at the last stop which always makes me happy." For 2025, field limits increase from 600 to 800 with new age group categories and post-ride shower additions.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $75-125. Franklin, Georgia isn't a destination hub—no airport details, no lodging strategy provided, which means you're driving and figuring out accommodations yourself. The GA/AL border location means most riders face significant travel unless they're regional, and the late February timing could complicate weather-dependent travel plans. Higher total cost than Badlands.

2024.conditions: - Historical weather incidents: Mud logjam and "Gravel Chaos" with walking sections in 2024; feet got dirty
key_takeaways: Historical weather incidents: Mud logjam and "Gravel Chaos" with walking sections in 2024; feet got dirty

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

youtube_data.search_query: Border Wars gravel race GA/AL border

videos.title: VTXL FKT: Riding 300 Miles Across Vermont
videos.description:
The VTXL is a 300 mile gravel route that spans the state of Vermont, from its northern border with Canada to its southern border with Massachusetts. For a small state, it packs a punch, as it's more than 90% gravel and delivers unrelenting climb after climb (after climb after climb after climb...).

Ted King was the first person to ride this route in 2021 as an all out assault, pushing his limits without stopping in a single 24 hour period. Hundreds of others have taken on the route in a more traditional bikepacking adventure over anywhere from two days to a week. Still others have since taken Ted's crown as the fastest known time, the FKT, as the time has ticked ever lower. 

Now with the record setting time remaining the same for more than a year, Ted thought he would give it a crack to take back his home-state gravel ultra. 

Presented by ​⁠@zippspeed on their 303 SW with additional support from ​⁠@ReneHerseCycleson their Poteau Mountain tires; see how the equipment stands up over this sub-22 hour ride.

Full ride here: https://www.strava.com/activities/15769370615


Video production by ​⁠www.ChrisMilliman.com

videos.title: Le Début (Tour de France Femmes): A Road to Nowhere Story - Pas Normal Studios
videos.description:
Le Début. Tour de France Femmes marks a new beginning for women’s cycling. We went on a journey to test three of the hardest stages of the race we’ve all been waiting for. Finally, the Tour lasts more than three weeks. 

Produced by Pas Normal Studios in partnership with Velux.

Explore more stories and rides here: https://pasnormalstudios.com/stories

Pas Normal Studios:
https://www.instagram.com/pasnormalstudios/

International Cycling Club:
https://www.instagram.com/internationalcyclingclub/

Website: https://pasnormalstudios.com/

#pasnormalstudios #internationalcyclingclub #tourdefrancefemmes

videos.title: 500 Miles Across Wyoming! 1975 Honda XL350 vs 1969 Yamaha DT-1 | Common Tread XP
videos.description:
https://rvz.la/3DmFPG9 | Thanks to Geico for sponsoring this episode of CTXP. Get a Fast & Free Quote!

Once upon a time, dirt roads were the only roads. In Wyoming there are more dirt roads than almost anywhere else, so Ari and Zack decided to step back in time. They found two vintage dual-sports, a 1975 Honda XL350 and a 1969 Yamaha DT-1, and tried to ride all the way from the eastern border Nebraska to the western border with Utah, without their tires touching pavement. The boys faced snow, wind, and mud for days, and at the end they came home with another epic Common Tread XP adventure.

Read all about Zack and Ari’s adventure on Common Tread! https://rvz.la/40cAqvc

Shop the gear

Zack’s Gear
Arai Classic V Groovy Helmet https://rvz.la/3Y08gkY
100% Barstow Telluride Goggles https://rvz.la/3XXQjn4
Merlin Sherbrook Flannel Riding Shirt https://rvz.la/3Rae35p
Gerbing Heated Vest https://rvz.la/3Y6b5Bd

Alpinestars Corozal Boots https://rvz.la/3WIqCpF
Alpinestars Oscar Cafe Divine Gloves https://rvz.la/3kIIN13

Velomacchi Speedway Backpack https://rvz.la/3DmI2RU

Ari’s Gear

Biltwell Moto Visor https://rvz.la/4031Svj
100% Barstow Roar Japan Goggles https://rvz.la/3WJCnvS
Thor Hallman Differ Roosted Jersey https://rvz.la/3JnnEUu

Street & Steel Eastwood Gloves https://rvz.la/3Hh9pOx
Alpinestars Winter Surfer Gloves https://rvz.la/3wCbDmq

Garmin InReach Mini GPS Tracker https://rvz.la/3R9MdGl
REAX Traveler Rain Gear https://rvz.la/3WJC9F2

videos.title: Bikepacking In Patagonia | GCN's South American Gravel Adventure
videos.description:
Bikepacking is all about adventure, discovery and exploring remote locations. Patagonia has these three things in abundance, so with the company of seasoned adventurer and world record holder Mark Beaumont, James set out on the adventure of a lifetime. Join Him and Mark on this three-day trip that sees them ride in stunning scenery, across road, gravel, lakes, and even borders!

In association with BMC Of Switzerland - Shimano & Vango 
https://www.bmc-switzerland.com/
https://bike.shimano.com/
https://www.vango.co.uk/gb/

With thanks to: https://yourpatagonia.com/


Check out the GCN Shop: https://gcn.eu/2QB
Subscribe to GCN: http://gcn.eu/SubscribeToGCN
#Cycling #GCN #RoadBike 


Where would you go for a cycling adventure? Let us know 👇

For all of our adventures and epic rides follow us on Komoot: https://gcn.eu/komoothr


Join our Facebook community: http://gcn.eu/FBCommunity 

If you enjoyed this video, make sure to give it a thumbs up and share it with your friends. 👍

If you'd like to contribute captions and video info in your language, here's the link -https://gcn.eu/2QD

Watch more on GCN...
📹  https://gcn.eu/2QE

Music - licensed by Epidemic Sound:
ES_A Winter's Tale - Sight of Wonders.wav
ES_ASR10 - Pro Reese.wav
ES_Chicken Got No Head - River Foxcroft.wav
ES_Full House Dusk - River Foxcroft.wav
ES_Inbound - Brendon Moeller.wav
ES_Not Forever (SLCT Remix) (Instrumental Version) - Duplex Heart.wav
ES_Outbreak - Fasion.wav
ES_Pontoon Boat Drive 14 - SFX Producer.wav
ES_Regeneration - Joseph Beg.wav
ES_Salmon Challis - By Lotus.wav
ES_Slow Silk Lullaby - Lama House.wav
ES_To Be Still - By Lotus (1).wav
ES_To Be Still - By Lotus.wav
ES_Waiting For Nothing - By Lotus.wav
ES_West of the Soul - River Foxcroft.wav

Photos: © Velo Collection (TDW) / Getty Images & © Bettiniphoto / http://www.bettiniphoto.net/

About GCN:

The Global Cycling Network puts you in the centre of the action: from the iconic climbs of Alpe D’Huez and Mont Ventoux to the cobbles of Flanders, everywhere there is road or pavé, world-class racing and pro riders, we will be there bringing you action, analysis and unparalleled access every week, every month, and every year. We show you how to be a better cyclist with our bike maintenance videos, tips for improving your cycling, cycling top tens, and not forgetting the weekly GCN Show. Join us on YouTube’s biggest and best cycling channel to get closer to the action and improve your riding!

Welcome to the Global Cycling Network | Inside #cycling

Thanks to our sponsors:

Pinarello Bikes https://gcn.eu/Pinarello
fi’zi:k Shoes & Saddles: http://gcn.eu/fizikshoes and http://gcn.eu/fiziksaddles
Enervit Nutrition: https://gcn.eu/Enervit
Topeak Tools: http://gcn.eu/Topeak
Canyon Bikes: http://gcn.eu/-Canyon
Bell Helmets: https://gcn.eu/bell
Quarq: http://gcn.eu/Quarq
Orbea Bikes: http://gcn.eu/Orbea
Vision Wheels: http://gcn.eu/Vision
Zipp Wheels: http://gcn.eu/Zipp
Wahoo Fitness: http://gcn.eu/Wahoo-Fitness 
Park Tool: http://gcn.eu/-parktool
Komoot Route Planning: https://gcn.eu/-komoot
Elite Bottles: https://gcn.eu/EliteBottles

GCN Japan: https://gcn.eu/subscribe-gcn-japan
GCN Italia: https://gcn.eu/GCN-Italia
Suscribirse a GCN en Español: http://gcn.eu/Suscribirse
The GCN Club - http://gcn.eu/club
YouTube Channel - http://gcn.eu/gcnYT
Facebook - http://gcn.eu/gcnFb

videos.title: Road rage driver knocks motorcyclist off bike after 50mph chase
videos.description:
The road rage episode was caught by the driver's own dashcam, although he initially lied to the police and said his camera was broken.
